summary: This is an email chain from June 27, 2019, discussing the retrieval of a non-public appendix to the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA). The appendix reportedly contains a list of victims entitled to compensation. The correspondence involves officials from the U.S. Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Director and Chief Counsel Office of Professional Responsibility
persons.context: The sender of an email stating that the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) will be able to help retrieve the non-public appendix to the Epstein NPA.

persons.name: Chief Public Corruption Unit United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The initial email sender inquiring whether the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) has a copy of the non-public NPA appendix or can help retrieve it.

events.title: Email Inquiry for Epstein NPA Appendix
events.description: An email chain is initiated to locate a non-public appendix to the Jeffrey Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement that contains a list of victims entitled to compensation.
personsInvolved: Director and Chief Counsel Office of Professional Responsibility
Chief Public Corruption Unit United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Washington, D.C. 20530
United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A non-public appendix exists to the Jeffrey Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).
The appendix contains a list of victims entitled to receive compensation.
As of June 2019, officials within the DOJ were attempting to locate or retrieve a copy of this appendix.
The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) was identified as an office that could assist in retrieving the document.
